txt.en: 'Following the siege, Mildreth's son Pendulf was angered by the death of his father, and the actions of Reeve Athelward. Pendulf accused Athelward of neglecting the people of Elthengels, and in turn, he declared treason against Pendulf. The two men fought a sword-trial, and Athelward emerged victorious. Pendulf only suffered a minor wound in their duel, but in time he became ill, and he passed away.\n\n'Mildreth's daughter, Sifl√°d has been sent to Cliving as ward to the Reeve.'
